results.title: The Stratford adventure
results.creator_credit: Morten Parker, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: How a small Canadian city, bearing the name of Stratford and by a river Avon, realized the vision of one of its sons: the creation of a theatre for the staging of the finest Shakespearean drama. The film tells how the idea grew, how a famous British director, Tyrone Guthrie, internationally known stars, Alec Guiness and Irene Worth, and Canadian talent were recruited, and how the Stratford Shakespearean Festival finally became a triumphant reality. (Awards: eight, including Edinburgh; Johannesburg; Oscar nomination, Hollywood)

results.title: Strangers in their own land
results.creator_credit: Chris Curling and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Examines Aboriginal land rights in the Weipa area of Northern Queensland, presenting both sides of the conflict between the Comalco bauxite miners and the Aboriginal people.

results.title: Stowaway. Part 2. Galley sanitation
results.brief_description: Illustrates precautions and sanitarymeasures which should be observed by all food service organisations. Points out that only these measure ensure safety for people served by them.

results.title: Stowaway. Part 3. Food storage
results.brief_description: Covers the inspection of food by the U.S. Army Veterinary Corps, the Bureau of Animal Industry and the Port Food Service Inspector prior to procurement for use aboard troop transports. Shows in detail the principles and proper facilities for food storage and preservation.

results.title: The Story of the six winged lions
results.creator_credit: Brian Cosgrove and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Magic ball”
Sam looks at a Chinese plate. The picture shows somone big, helped by six winged lions, to bully a smaller person. Sam decides to use the power of the magic ball, and do something about it.

results.title: Story of Ted Hughes
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The story of the rehabilitation of a youth who lost a leg in an accident as a boy. The services rendered by the Rehabilitation Branch of the Social Services are indicated including physiotherapy, occupational therapy, study and recreation. Problems of employing disabled people are studied with recognition given to the fact that it is ability, not disability, that counts.

results.title: The Story of Tasmania
results.brief_description: A description of the island of Tasmania, giving something of its history, geography, agriculture and main industries; including discovery and settlement; physical environment; pastoral industries; agricultural, mining, timber and fishing industries; main cities and towns; and Tasmania’s railway system. Narrated by Roger Climpson.

results.title: The Story of my life: a film about Hans Andersen
results.creator_credit: Erik Witte, Jorgen Roos, Dansk Kulturfilm and Teknisk Film
results.brief_description: The life of Hans Christian Andersen. The son of a poor cobbler, he becomes Denmark’s national poet. The film reveals the strange childhood from which he derived the whimsy and fantasy of his fairy tales. As a boy of fourteen, he went to Copenhagen, bent on achieving fame in one way or another. He failed to impress the theatrical producers but obtained a scholarship from the King of Denmark. Soon he was writing short stories, plays, poems, novels and fairy tales.
